The scary stealth ‘em up is the first of a series of games published by Sega that are going DRM-free on GOG. Two Point Hospital and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine – Anniversary Edition will be joining the store at an unspecified date too. 

 
Read more
articles.title: GOG's Summer Sale kicks off with Alien Isolation going DRM-free at 75% off

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Every weekend, indie devs show off current work on Twitter's #screenshotsaturday tag. And every Monday, I bring you a selection of these snaps and clips. This week, my eye has been caught by several high-speed first-person shooters, some good wizarding, and a cute mushroom friend.
Read more
articles.title: Screenshot Saturday Mondays: ultraviolence, shoving, and shrooms

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Pop your collar because EA and Maxis have confirmed that the next expansion for The Sims 4 is growing a bit hairy thanks to the return of werewolves on June 16th. The Sims 4: Werewolves is the 12th game pack released for the ever-growing life sim so far, and will add the new world of Moonwood Mill, which is simply heaving with the canine monstrosities. Howl at the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sims 4's Werewolves transformation is set for June 16th

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Multiplayer FPS Escape From Tarkov is getting a dedicated PvP spin-off in the form of Escape From Tarkov Arena, developers Battlestate Games have announced on Twitter. Battlestate say Arena will be a “standalone” game, so you won't need to own the original Tarkov in order to play it, but clarified that anyone who owns Escape From Tarkov’s ‘Edge of Darkess’ pack will have free access to it as DLC. Watch the teaser trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Escape From Tarkov Arena is a new standalone gladiatorial FPS

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Xalavier Nelson Jr has a bit of a love hate relationship with screens right now. As development on his studio’s gutsy market game Space Warlord Organ Trading Simulator was wrapping up at the end of last year, he tells me he remembers “just being really angry at the concept of the borders of the screen”. He was, by his own admission, in “a vague fugue state” at the time, having spent months immersed in Space Warlord’s black and green trading interfaces. But the feeling of having his game “chained to these walls” at the edge of his monitor proved to be a surprisingly powerful one - so much so that it spurred Nelson Jr and his team at Strange Scaffold to create an entirely new kind of game in the months leading up to Warlord’s release: Witch Strandings.

That's right. Taking cues from Hideo Kojima’s hiking postal sim Death Stranding, Witch Strandings is a game that not only asks what Sam Bridges’ cross-country cargo routes might look like if they were made with a fraction of Kojima’s development budget, but also how games can create experiences that are “larger than my screen,” says Nelson Jr. And the answer, it turns out, lies in your PC’s humble mouse.
Read more
articles.title: How Witch Strandings is moving Hideo Kojima’s Strand game ideals into new, slightly cursed territory

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
The developers of survival horror game The Callisto Protocol have announced that it'll be coming out in December, and revealed a new gameplay trailer to watch with the sound off through your fingers.
Read more
articles.title: Survival horror game The Callisto Protocol is coming in December

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Stray, the game about being a little cat exploring around a big cybercity, has a release date - and it's soon! July, in fact. That's next month! Time flies when you're excited about getting to be a ginger tabby kitty.
Read more
articles.title: Cat simulator Stray will wander out into its cybercity in July

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Capcom have released a new trailer for Street Fighter 6, showcasing an open-world mode that sees characters exploring and brawling alike on the between the neon signs of the city.
Read more
articles.title: Street Fighter 6 will bring an open-world mode when it launches next year

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XVI has released another trailer. This one's for showing off the summons and giving it a release window of summer next year. Summons for the summer!
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy XVI gets a new trailer, summer 2023 release window

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Both of Insomniac Games' web-slingin', super villain kickin' games are coming to PC this year. Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered will be out this August, while Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales is scheduled for the autumn.
Read more
articles.title: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered and Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales are heading to PC

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Capcom have confirmed that Resident Evil 4 is getting a remake. It's due out in March of next year.
Read more
articles.title: Capcom announce Resident Evil 4 remake, due March 2023

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
BioWare have given a new tease for Dragon Age 4, announcing that its official title will be Dragon Age: Dreadwolf. It'll follow up that plot about Solas wanting to destroy the entire world - fantastic news for fans and haters alike.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age's next entry will be called Dragon Age: Dreadwolf

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
A very merry Pride month to all, and what better way to celebrate than by putting some money in queer developers' pockets and getting more than 500 games (and zines and other such goodies) in return? There's a bit of everything in here, from a bird-run grocery store to a meditation on the decay and connection both inherent to today's internet.
Read more
articles.title: Itch.io's Queer Games Bundle is back, offering hundreds of games for Pride month

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
This week on the Electronic Wireless Show podcast we clear up an initial misunderstanding but eventually get in sync and talk about the game things we'd want in real life: health packs, tetris, inventory management. By their powers combined we manage to create an absolutely nightmarish dystopian society where people live forever but cannot put more than four of the same thing in a line. It's bleak. Games should stay in games.
Matthew continues the Wolfe Carlton saga, Nate is making a crayfish into a mini-model, and I have a cold. A regular cold! No funny business. Matthew also does a very hard Cavern Of Lies this week that honestly nearly has us.
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show episode 189: the best thing from a game you want in real life

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
The Steam Deck's docking station has been delayed, says Valve. Unfortunately, there's currently no way to tell when the issue might be resolved.
Read more
articles.title: The Steam Deck's docking station has been delayed

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
“I haven’t really had time to let it sink in yet, I don’t think,” says Jeremy Fielding, community manager for Stunlock Studios. When we spoke on Tuesday, their early access vampire sim survival game V Rising had just passed 1.5 million players, far beyond the team’s wildest expectations.
Read more
articles.title: V Rising dev talks success, surprises, and future plans

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
It's not good to dwell too much on the past. Unless, of course, you're playing Old Skies, the newly announced point and click adventure game from Wadjet Eye studios. In that case, you'll need to cast your mind back, because cross-temporal puzzling is what it's all about. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Wadjet Eye announce time travelling adventure Old Skies

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
Sega have released a look at the world and exploration of Sonic Frontiers, giving us a glimpse of just what it might be like to go fast, open world style.
Read more
articles.title: Sonic Frontiers shows off seven minutes of open world gameplay

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Because I now live in a country that isn't the UK, I get different bank holidays to staff in the UK, which it turns out is almost everyone else. This means I'm at work today and Friday. For other people outside the UK who don't know, this weekend it is celebrating the Queen's Platinum Jubilee. She's the first UK monarch to manage 70 years on the throne, most of the other ones having killed each other or somesuch. The country, specifically England, has responded to this by going absolutely off the boil, represented even in digi-form with a virtual street party map in Minecraft. I wouldn't normally write about it, but it gives me an excuse to republican-post on main when nobody is looking.
Read more
articles.title: A Jubilee street party in Minecraft is the least worst version of the actual Jubilee, I guess

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Čtyři dny máme na světě verzi jádra Linux 5.19-rc1. Vše, co mělo být začleněno, již bylo a příští verze jádra nyní prochází závěrečným cyklem vývoje. Zastavme se tedy ještě jednou u 5.19. Naposledy.
articles.title: Novinky pro Linux 5.19: překopaný zvukový ovladač či Hardware Timestamping Engine

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Macek)
articles.description: Tento článek má za úkol ukázat, jak provádět některé operace s certifikáty a jak je automatizovat. Nebudeme se dnes zabývat věcmi jako certifikační autorita, kotva apod. Chci raději ukázat praktickou část.
articles.title: Certifikáty prakticky s utilitou OpenSSL: formáty, prohlížení, převody a testování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Už jsme se již setkali s několika nástroji pro tvorbu grafů. Dnes se seznámíme s knihovnou Bokeh, která je určena pro tvorbu grafů v Pythonu, přičemž výsledkem je interaktivní webová stránka s „živým“ a interaktivním grafem.
articles.title: Tvorba interaktivních grafů pro webové stránky a aplikace s využitím knihovny Bokeh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: V této kapitole se podíváme ve větším detailu na použité čipy a jejich základní vlastnosti. V druhé části článku zmíním první dojmy z provedení počítače a podíváme se na jeho možnosti konektivity.
articles.title: Projekt C64: čipová sada a první důkladné seznámení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme jednoduchou aplikaci pro přenos souborů, zaznamenáme si pár poznámek, nalepíme si pár štítků a řekneme si o aplikaci pro sdílení zvuku.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (8. 6. 2022): jednoduchý přenos souborů mezi počítači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: IPv6 je tu s námi oficiálně už deset let, v praxi ale ještě mnohem déle. Někdy to vypadá, že IPv6 vlastně nikdo nepotřebuje, kromě několika nadšenců. Je tomu ale skutečně tak? Nepotřebujeme nakonec IPv6 všichni?
articles.title: IPv6 deset let poté: kam jsme se dostali dekádu po velkém zapnutí?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ve druhém článku o tvorbě her a grafických či zvukových dem pro osmibitovou herní konzoli NES se seznámíme s programátorským modelem mikroprocesoru MOS 6502 (resp. Ricoh 2A03.) a vysvětlíme si, jak vlastně skutečně pracuje kostra reálného programu pro NES.
articles.title: Základy tvorby her pro herní konzoli NES: mikroprocesor 6502 a assembler ca65

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: Dnes se dozvíte, jak infikovat počítač pouhým náhledem souboru nebo otevřením e-mailu, jak otevřít auto bez klíčků a také o úspěšném boji proti malware, který terorizoval mobilní zařízení.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: počítač infikovaný náhledem souboru či e-mailu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Unikla databáze s daty více než 20 tisíc uživatelů distribuce Linuxfx. Textový editor Gedit bude v Ubuntu 22.10 nahrazen GNOME Text Editorem. NixOS má nově grafický instalátor systému.
articles.title: Unikla databáze uživatelů Linuxfx, Ubuntu vymění textový editor

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený dopis za otevření kódu Intel Firmware Support Package (FSP), Wine 7.10 opravuje 17 let starou chybu-nechybu, KDE Plasma 5.25 stále ještě nehotová, Vivaldi 5.3 na bázi Chromia 102.
articles.title: Telefony Murena s /e/OS jsou v prodeji, Firefox 103 možná s akcelerací videa přes VA-API

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ubuntu 22.04 na desktopu má ve výchozím stavu aktivovaný systemd-oomd, který v případě nedostatku paměti ukončí některé procesy. Problémem je, že tak činí příliš brzy, bez jakýchkoliv známek, že se blíží OOM. A také podle skóre často zabije Chrome či gnome-shell.
articles.title: Problémy se systemd-oomd v Ubuntu 22.04

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com můžete zdarma získat RPG hru Venetica – Gold Edition (pro získání hry jděte na první link a hledejte asi uprostřed stránky). Hra se odehrává ve fantasy Benátkách a ovládáte hrdinku Scarlett. Hra je sice dostupná pouze pro Windows, ale vypadá to, že je možné ji hrát s pomocí Wine.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na GOG.com: Venetica - Gold Edition

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ještě v březnu jsme psali, že rekord v počtu cifer čísla π je 63 biliónů. Ve středu však byl zveřejněn nový rekord výpočtu π, které bylo spočítáno na 100 biliónů cifer. Za výpočtem stojí  Emma Haruka Iwao z Google a k výpočtu byl použit Google Cloud se 128 virtuálními CPU a 864 GB RAM. Při výpočtu není až tak důležitá hrubá síla, jako spíše úložiště. K dispozici bylo 663 TB, z toho bylo použito 515 TB. Celkově bylo zapsáno 38,5 PB a přečteno 43,5 PB.
articles.title: Nový rekord výpočtu π od Google

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Máte spravovat síťové prvky společnosti MikroTik, ale chybí vám potřebné znalosti a zkušenosti? Přijďte na naše školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a kromě všech důležitých informací si domů odnesete i vlastní router MikroTik.
articles.title: Přijďte na školení MikroTik od základů po velkou síť a odnesete si router

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno jsme informovali, že Python 3.11 je asi o 40 % rychlejší, než Python 3.10. Včera pak server Phoronix zveřejnil test CPythonu (referenční C implementace Pythonu) 3.11 beta 1 a beta 3 s alternativními historicky rychlejšími implementacemi PyPy 3.9-v7.3.9 a Pyston 2.3.3.
articles.title: PyPy a Pyston jsou rychlejší než CPython 3.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: GitHub oznámil, že na konci letošního roku ukončí vývoj programátorského textového editoru Atom. Ten vznikl v roce 2011 a uživatelé si ho rychle oblíbili díky jeho širokým možnostem a přizpůsobitelnosti. Firma tvrdí, že v posledních letech v editoru nepřibývaly téměř žádné funkce a komunita skomírala. Uživatelé se prý přesouvají ke cloudovým službám skrze Microsoft Visual Studio Code nebo GitHub Codespaces.
articles.title: GitHub ukončí vývoj programátorského editoru Atom

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Národní úřad pro kybernetickou a informační bezpečnost (NÚKIB) zveřejnil druhou verzi dokumentu Minimální požadavky na kryptografické algoritmy [PDF]. Subjekty spadající pod zákon o kybernetické bezpečností je musejí zohlednit za účelem ochrany aktiv informačního a komunikačního systému.
articles.title: NÚKIB aktualizoval minimální požadavky na kryptografické algoritmy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Včera byla vydána aktualizovaná verze enterprisové distribuce SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP4 (SLES), dnes na ni navazuje komunitní edice openSUSE Leap 15.4, sestavovaná ze stejných zdrojů.
articles.title: Nové verze openSUSE Leap 15.4 a SLES 15 SP4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Variabilní snímková frekvence jako součást běhu desktopového prostředí, je v projektu GNOME zas o krok blíž. Do kódu kompozitoru Mutter doputovaly příslušné patche, podpora VRR byla vyvíjena poslední dva roky.
articles.title: GNOME Mutter dostává podporu VRR

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linuxových systémů přibývá, každý den se spouštějí nové servery a někdo se o ně musí starat. To znamená spoustu různých dovedností specifických právě pro linuxové prostředí. Jak to zprovoznit, kudy bezpečně dovnitř, co tam najdeme, jak se o to postaráme a jak to nastavíme nebo rozšíříme.
articles.title: Naučte se používat Linux správně a bezpečně (online školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Už tuto sobotu a neděli se můžete těšit na 32 zajímavých přednášek a 6 workshopů na dalším ročníku konference InstallFest. Konference o Linuxu, open-source a o všem, co s tím souvisí, je určena pro začátečníky i odborníky.
articles.title: InstallFest proběhne už tento víkend, přijďte na Karlovo náměstí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři Intelu již pracují na podpoře přespříští 14. generace procesorů Intel Core, tedy Meteor Lake. Připomeňme, že v současnosti má od loňského listopadu Intel na trhu procesory Alder Lake a letos hodlá uvést jejich nástupce Raptor Lake. Teprve poté přijde výše zmíněný Meteor Lake, a to nejdříve v mobilních verzích, o které tu v Corebootu primárně jde, desktopy až několik měsíců poté.
articles.title: Coreboot dostává patche s podporou Intel Meteor Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Správce české národní domény rozšířil svoji spolupráci se společností Internet Multifeed, která provozuje JPNAP, největší peeringový uzel v Asijsko-pacifickém regionu, v němž sdružení CZ.NIC provozuje sekundární jmenný server. Na základě dodatku ke společnému memorandu z roku 2011 došlo během uplynulých měsíců nejen k upgradu hardware DNS serveru, ale také ke zvýšení kapacity jeho připojení, díky čemuž se zlepšila dostupnost české národní domény pro uživatele z regionu východní Asie. Upgrade tohoto uzlu je součástí periodické údržby DNS anycastu české národní domény.
articles.title: CZ.NIC posílil DNS anycast v japonském Tokiu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Apple nadále pokračuje v převodu svých počítačů z architektury Intel x86_64 na vlastní 64bit čipy Apple Silicon (aktuální řada M1 a čerstvě ohlášená M2). Firma nyní s novým vydáním macOS 13 připravila možnost běhu intelovských binárek pro architekturu x86_64 na svých ARM čipech, a to za pomoci vrstvy Rosetta a virtuálního stroje postaveného na Linuxu. Podrobně vše popisuje Apple na svém webu.
articles.title: Nový macOS 13 přidává podporu běhu x86_64 binárek na Apple M1/M2 díky vrstvě Rosetta

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Druhá generace 5nm procesu TSMC a 20 miliard tranzistorů, to jsou dva klíčové parametry, které předurčují výkon nového ARM SoC pro počítače Apple. Nakousnuté jablko posouvá dál hranice, nový procesor nabízí propustnost 128bit LPDDR5 paměťového subsystému na 100 GB/s (adresovat umí až 24 GB RAM), kombinaci 4+4 CPU jader (4 výkonná, 4 efektivní).
articles.title: Apple ohlásil procesor M2, výkon narostl až o 35 %

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Server Phoronix dnes otestoval výkon Pythonu 3.11 Beta 1, který vyšel minulý měsíc. Python 3.11 by již měl zahrnovat zrychlení z projektu „Faster CPython Project“. Podle oficiálního testu pyperformance je 3.11 o 25 % rychlejší než 3.10. Ale podle druhu zátěže lze očekávat zrychlení v rozmezí 10–60 %.
articles.title: Python 3.11 beta 1 ukazuje podstatné zrychlení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Alternativa k počítači v klávesnici Raspberry Pi 400 od čínského výrobce Orange Pi se jmenuje Orange Pi 800. Je postavena na CPU Rockchip RK3399 (šest jader, 2× Cortex-A72 1,8 GHz a 4× Cortex-A53 1,4 GHz) a obsahuje 4 GB RAM, 64 GB eMMC a microSD kartu, HDMI výstup s rozlišením 4k a VGA výstup s rozlišením FullHD.
articles.title: Orange Pi 800: počítač v klávesnici a alternativa k Raspberry Pi 400

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Do jádra 5.19 se dostala záplata od Thomase Gleixnera a Borislava Petkova, která ve výchozím stavu vypíná pozdní nahrávání mikrokódu, protože to v některých případech nefunguje a jedná se tedy o loterii. Tato konfigurace MICROCODE_OLD_INTERFACE (deprecated) je přejmenována na MICROCODE_LATE_LOADING (dangerous). Pozdní aktualizace mikrokódu používala /dev/cpu/microcode a nástroje iucode_tool nebo microcode.ctl. Nově bude při použití pozdní aktualizace jádro také označeno (tainted).
articles.title: Pozdní nahrávání mikrokódu pro x86 je pokládáno za loterii

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Zálohovací software Timeshift je podobný jako Time Machine pro macOS nebo System Restore ve Windows. Používá buď rsync a hardlinky, nebo BTRFS snapshoty. Od běžných zálohovacích programů se liší v tom, že zálohuje jen operační systém a ne soubory uživatelů.
articles.title: Linux Mint převezme vývoj zálohovacího software Timeshift

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Staré Apple iPady s procesory A7 a A8 z let 2013–2014 již nedostávají žádné aktualizace od Apple, ale dva nadšenci Konrad Dybcio a quaack723 dokázali na nich spustit jádro 5.18. Použitá byla distribuce postmarketOS, která je odvozena od Alpine Linuxu a je používána hlavně na zařízeních s Androidem.
articles.title: Na starých Apple iPadech s procesory A7 a A8 běží Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: V polovině června navštíví Prahu Gil Tene – spoluzakladatel a CTO firmy Azul, která vyvíjí vlastní implementaci platformy Java. V Praze se zúčastní dvou meetupů, na kterých přednese přednášky
articles.title: Pozvánka na přednášky Java After Eight a Java at Speed

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před dvěma týdny jsme informovali, že vývojář software pro odstranění šumu z mikrofonu NoiseTorch měl podezření, že s kódem mohlo být manipulováno. Komunita zdrojový kód podrobila auditu a nic nebezpečného nenašla.
articles.title: NoiseTorch 0.12.0, audit nic špatného neobjevil

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla pracuje na offline překladači Bergamot již od roku 2019 spolu s univerzitami v Edinburku, Sheffieldu, Tartu a Karlovou univerzitou v Praze. Projekt byl podporován EU. Včera byla oznámena dostupnost rozšíření pro Firefox s názvem Firefox Translation.
articles.title: Vydán nástroj pro offline překlad Bergamot od Mozilly

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chceš začít s programováním? Python je oblíbený programovací jazyk mezi vývojáři i zaměstnavateli a zároveň super vstupenka do světa programování. Nauč se přemýšlet jako programátor a efektivně využívat Python na řešení nejrůznějších problémů. Online Python Akademie znamená celkem 12 týdnů, vždy jedna lekce týdně, večer od 18:00 do 21:00. Následující kurz začíná 16. června.
articles.title: Online Python Akademie: začněte s programováním v oblíbeném jazyce (online kurz)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ubuntu 21.10 Impish Indri vyšlo už před devíti měsíci (článek na Rootu) a jelikož jde o běžné vydání s krátkou životností, blíží se nyní konec jeho podpory. Ten byl ohlášen na 14. června a po tomto datu přestanou vycházet bezpečnostní aktualizace. Uživatelé by tedy měli brzy aktualizovat, podporovaná je cesta přes Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.
articles.title: Ubuntu 21.10 Impish Indri končí s podporou 14. června

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak vyrábět cihly na Marsu. Genetický editor CRISPR kouzlí s bramborami. Jak funguje kosmická pavučina. Tisk chytrých senzorů na dřevo.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Toulavé planety namísto kosmických lodí

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vědci přišli na levnou výrobu nejlepšího grafenu. Umělá inteligence od Konica Minolta dokáže sledovat spokojenost zákazníků. Proč 85 % organizací do roku 2025 nasadí kontejnery? Poptávka po odbornících na kyberbezpečnost strmě roste, stejně tak i jejich platy. Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 22/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Za kolik antihmoty může běžná hmota? Zbývá něco na temnou? Nejsilnější marsotřesení. Ceres měl vzniknout až za Saturnem. Z atomů uhlíku sestavili Möbiovu pásku. Diamantová zrcadla pro výkonné lasery.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Zpřesnili hodnotu Hubbleovy konstanty, problém ale trvá

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Supernabídka od Goodoffer24 pokračuje i v červnu! Nejzajímavější z nabídek je bezpochyby doživotní licence na Windows 10 za pouhých € 11, u které připomínáme, že vám dovoluje upgradovat na Windows 11 zdarma! Hovoříme přitom o doživotní licenci, u které vám garantujeme výměnu 30 dní od nákupu v případě, že by se vyskytl nějaký problém. Také potvrzujeme excelentní nabídky na balíky Office ve verzi 2016, které můžete koupit za € 23 s doživotní licencí.
articles.title: Doživotní licence na Windows 10 za € 11, Office za € 23, v červnu s námi ušetříte až 91 %!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak jsme na tom s řízením kybernetické bezpečnosti. Broadcom převezme VMware za 61 miliard dolarů. Nový IT normál? Cloudové služby, edge computing a automatizace. Téměř polovina finančních ředitelů považuje samoobslužná data a analytiku za hnací sílu produktivity zaměstnanců. Elektroniku čeká další zdražování, zejména kvůli růstu cen čipů. Zdokonalovat lze i kvantové simulátory.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Zdokonalovat lze i kvantové simulátory

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 21/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vznik života a kvantové tečky. Hledání Dysonových sfér u bílých trpaslíků. Poprvé syntetizovali materiál při tlaku, jaký panuje v jádru Uranu. Drony mohou rozsypávat bezdrátové senzory.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: V CERNu změřili hmotnost kvarku c

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Mezi základní návyky lidí s pokročilou úrovní finanční gramotnosti patří investování přebytečných financí do výnosných aktiv. Jak ale s investováním začít a na jaká rizika si dát pozor? Poradíme vám v dnešním článku.
articles.title: Creditas: Jak začít investovat a na co si dát pozor?

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Microsoft Teams zvládá automatický zápis schůzek. Hewlett Packard Enterprise v Česku staví nový výrobní závod na superpočítače. Acer omladí pracovní notebooky TravelMate P4, TravelMate Spin P4 a TravelMate P2. Pure dále zpřístupňuje podnikům Kubernetes. Zasuneš a jedeš. Kubernetes: obliba roste, problém zůstává bezpečnost a know-how. O financování většiny podnikového IT se rozhoduje (i) mimo IT oddělení.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: O financování většiny podnikového IT se rozhoduje (i) mimo IT oddělení

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Počítačovou hru Resident Evil Village ve webovém prohlížeči Chrome lze vyzkoušet i na Linuxu. Bez registrace. Stačí kliknou [Google Stadia].
articles.title: Resident Evil Village ve webovém prohlížeči

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Prusa Resarch slaví 10 let. Stručný přehled událostí na časové ose. K příležitosti výročí je v prodeji Original Prusa i3 MK3S+ 10th Anniversary Edition.
articles.title: Prusa Resarch slaví 10 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Vivaldi Mail, poštovní klient integrovaný ve webovém prohlížeči Vivaldi, dospěl do verze 1.0. Stejně tak Vivaldi Calendar a Vivaldi Feed Reader. Povolit je lze v nastavení ("Enable Mail, Calendar and Feeds" nebo "Povolit poštu, kalendář a odběry"). Videoukázka na YouTube.
articles.title: Vivaldi Mail dospěl do verze 1.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 1.68 editoru zdrojových kódů Visual Studio Code (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek i s náhledy a animovanými gify v poznámkách k vydání. Ve verzi 1.68 vyjde také VSCodium, tj. komunitní sestavení Visual Studia Code bez telemetrie a licenčních podmínek Microsoftu.
articles.title: Visual Studio Code a VSCodium 1.68

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Konrad Dybcio a Markuss Broks rozběhali Linux na procesorech A7 až A8X (iPhone, iPad, …).
articles.title: Linux na procesorech A7 až A8X (iPhone, iPad, …)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Emma Haruka Iwao na blogu Googlu informuje, že Pí bylo vypočítáno na 100 bilionů číslic.
articles.title: Pí na 100 bilionů číslic

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Národní úřad pro kybernetickou a informační bezpečnost (NÚKIB) vydal (pdf) aktualizovanou verzi dokumentu obsahující doporučení v oblasti kryptografických prostředků.
articles.title: Doporučení v oblasti kryptografických prostředků verze 2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Třetí den konference SUSECON Digital 2022, třetí videoklip od SUSE: We Didn't Start the Kernel - A SUSE Music Parody.
articles.title: We Didn't Start the Kernel - A SUSE Music Parody

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: GitHub oznámil ukončení vývoje open source editoru Atom (Wikipedie).
articles.title: GitHub oznámil ukončení vývoje editoru Atom

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 3.2 svobodného 3D softwaru Blender. Přehled novinek v oznámení o vydání a na YouTube.
articles.title: Blender 3.2

articles.description: PoCL 3.0 has been formally released today for this portable OpenCL implementation that supports execution on CPUs or other back-ends by way of LLVM such as for targeting AMD HSA, NVIDIA GPUs, and other accelerators. With PoCL 3.0 comes initial OpenCL 3.0 support while the actual conformance results are still pending...
articles.title: PoCL 3.0 Released With Minimal OpenCL 3.0 Implementation For CPUs

articles.description: This week's release of Blender 3.2 brings AMD GPU rendering support on Linux via AMD's HIP interface in conjunction with their ROCm compute stack. Eager to see the AMD GPU support on Linux finally arrive, I quickly began trying out this new Blender open-source 3D modeling software release while seeing how the AMD RDNA2 HIP performance compares to that of NVIDIA GeForce RTX 30 GPUs that have long enjoyed top-notch support under Blender.
articles.title: Blender 3.2 Performance With AMD Radeon HIP vs. NVIDIA GeForce On Linux

articles.description: MIT CSAIL today is lifting the embargo on a new hardware vulnerability affecting the Apple M1 SoCs (no word yet on exposure with the recently announced Apple M2) and dubbed the "PACMAN" attack...
articles.title: Apple M1 Affected By "PACMAN" Hardware Vulnerability In Arm Pointer Authentication

articles.description: In recent weeks Ubuntu developers have been working on bringing up and improving support for the Starfive VisionFive, which is one of the most promising "low-cost" RISC-V single board computers to date. Hopefully for Ubuntu 22.10 we'll be seeing good support for this sub-$180 RISC-V computer...
articles.title: Ubuntu Working To Provide Good Support For The VisionFive Low-Cost RISC-V Board

articles.description: With the Linux 5.19 merge window past, the initial batch of drm-misc-next feature changes targeting the Linux 5.20 kernel have been mailed in to DRM-Next for queuing until that next kernel merge window kicks off later in the summer...
articles.title: Panfrost's Initial Arm Mali Valhall Support Sent In To DRM-Next For Linux 5.20

articles.description: It was just back in April that Sound Open Firmware 2.1 released as the newest version of the open-source audio DSP firmware stack started by Intel and also even being used by other select hardware vendors as well. Sound Open Firmware 2.2 is on the way as the newest feature release for Intel's "SOF" project...
articles.title: Sound Open Firmware 2.2 Preparing More Optimizations, More Zephyr Usage

articles.description: This week Phoronix.com turned 18 years old! In marking that milestone, a Phoronix Premium special was offered for enjoying the site ad-free, multi-page articles on a single page, and other benefits while supporting the site for hoping to help provide a successful 19th year of Phoronix Linux hardware testing and news operations. If you want to participate, that special ends this weekend...
articles.title: It's Last Call For The Phoronix 18th Birthday Premium Special

articles.description: Adding to the list of many exciting features in Linux 5.19 is a new DMA-BUF fence import/export API for improving the usage of explicit synchronization on the Linux desktop to help with Vulkan and allowing more of the Linux desktop to move in the future to a more explicit synchronization model...
articles.title: Linux 5.19 Advances In Quest To Improve Explicit Synchronization For Graphics

articles.description: AMD today hosted their 2022 Financial Analyst Day where they made some new disclosures and firmed up past product road-map plans...
articles.title: AMD Talks Up Zen 4 AVX-512, Genoa, Siena & More At Financial Analyst Day

articles.description: One of the many changes with the recent Ubuntu 22.04 LTS release was enabling systemd-oomd by default as the out-of-memory daemon that can kill processes when under memory pressure. Unfortunately, for some users this has led to a poor desktop experience with finding their applications being unexpectedly killed. Ubuntu developers are now discussing how to improve this OOMD handling...
articles.title: Ubuntu Deciding How To Tame Their systemd-oomd Killing Experience

articles.description: PipeWire 0.3.52 was released today as the newest version of this open-source server for handling audio/video streams on the Linux desktop and increasingly being used now as a replacement for PulseAudio...
articles.title: PipeWire 0.3.52 Released To Continue Enhancing Linux Audio/Video Streams

articles.description: There was much interest in the recent Python 3.11 beta benchmarks showing much performance uplift from this in-development version of Python compared to prior 3.x releases. While Python 3.11 performance is looking great and huge advantages compared to prior versions, there are also alternative Python implementations like PyPy and Pyston. Stemming from Phoronix reader requests, here are benchmarks showing how Python 3.11 beta performance compares to those alternative Python implementations.

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
The store essentially exploded immediately after it went on sale
After an unfortunate rollout of the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 special edition pre-order system, Nintendo says they're taking another crack at it.
Everything seemed OK on the surface. Nintendo was having pre-orders take place on the My Nintendo store on June 8, with a "limit of two per account." So far, so good. Then it actually launched.
Immediately after the Xenoblade Chronicles 3 special edition went on sale, the entire Nintendo storefront crashed. Folks were greeted with some combination of a 404 page or a "queue," that took an indeterminate amount of time to load and didn't have a progress bar. I came in a little after the initial rush and was taken out of the queue after roughly 10 minutes, and plopped onto a buggy store pa…
articles.title: After the rocky initial launch, Nintendo says there will be another wave of Xenoblade Chronicles 3 special edition pre-orders

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
It's a sweet symphony
Netflix has confirmed a new Castlevania animated series is on the way, and it's centered around a new Belmont. Castlevania: Nocturne is officially in production for Netflix, featuring Richter Belmont.
The new trailer from Netflix's Geeked Week stream doesn't show too much, other than a good look at Richter himself. Still, he's here, in full Belmont garb and whip in tow.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ONqNEPTPyqU
Richter is a descendant of Trevor Belmont and Sypha Belnades, so that should make for an interesting continuation of the show. And longtime Castlevania fans are probably already very excited about Nocturne tackling Richter, considering his source material. Video game Richter means both Rondo of Blood and Symphony of the Night could be fodder for adaptation.
The series will be led by showrunner Kevin Kolde and creator/writer Clive Bradley, and produced by Project 51 Productions with production services from Powerhouse Animation.
Rondo round the world
Considering the Castlevania Netflix series has traditionally been a looser adaptation of the source material, I wouldn't expect Castlevania: Nocturne to be a full-on retelling of Rondo of Blood or Symphony of the Night. That said, Richter alone provides a lot of fodder for potential story beats between those two games. Plus, having Richter here means we could see the return of Alucard. Who doesn't want that?
We got a tease of this last year, but it's excellent to see the Castlevania adaptations are carrying on. While the streaming service has had some standouts in the adaptation department, Castelvania remains one of my favorites. The storming-the-castle finale of Season 2 is forever seared in my brain. I'm more than ready for some adventures with Richter.
The post Castlevania: Nocturne is coming to Netflix, following Richter Belmont appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Castlevania: Nocturne is coming to Netflix, following Richter Belmont

articles.author: Destructoid Staff
articles.description:
Not your everyday JRPG
[This week Destructoid is brought to you by Metal Max Xeno Reborn, out now for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and PC (via Steam). This is a sponsored post.]
The long-awaited Western release of Metal Max Xeno Reborn is finally here on Nintendo Switch, PS4, and PC, and Pochi the cannon-packing pooch is calling your name.
Not only can you "pet the dog" in this post-apocalyptic open-world JRPG from Kadokawa Games, he's actually an active part of the squad! Some might even say Pochi is the MVP. Together, you'll face ferocious oddball threats like dinosaur battleships, massive sand sharks, and missile-armed rhinos. This isn't your average JRPG tank adventure, that's for sure.
Metal Max Xeno Reborn is one of many RPGs in the lovably outlandish Metal Max series, which dates…
articles.title: Don’t miss Metal Max Xeno Reborn now that it’s on PC, PS4, and Switch

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
(But that's still a pointlessly convoluted title)
During yesterday's Summer Game Fest 2022 live stream, publisher Capcom dropped a trailer for its clumsily titled retro compilation Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium. The short clip gave us a flashy montage of visual and audio elements pulled from a list of 32 classic arcade hits headed to PC and consoles in July.
Among the famous brands featured in the new collection are gothic fighter Darkstalkers, ring-rocker Muscle Bomber/Saturday Night Slam Masters, action-platformers Mega Man and SonSon, and frantic shmups Hyper Dyne Side Arms, 1943 Kai, and Exed Exes. As with the original Capcom Arcade Stadium, players can choose to purchase titles in individual bundles, or can bag themselves the entire collection for a localized price of $39.99. Additionally…
articles.title: Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium game list includes Darkstalkers, Muscle Bomber, and more

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Coming to the Epic Games Store on PC
Did you know there's an Epic Games Store showcase going on right now? Me neither! More Lord of the Rings-licensed games are on the way beyond that vague EA mobile project and the Gollum title; as The Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria was just announced today.
The trailer opens up at the Doors of Durin, before showcasing a group of dwarves (players) quite literally heading back into Moria. Social elements (group drinking), survival moments (evading orcs that are still skulking about the halls), crafting, and building seem to be in play. Development is handled by Free Range Games, who has worked as an external developer on several titles, and handled primary development for Spelldrifter.
Here's a quick description that sums up the vibe:
"To survive the treacherous mines of Moria players must conserve resources, hunt and gather for food and manage their sleep, temperature and noise levels. Utilize dynamic light systems for safety and to blaze a path further into the darkness. Battle unspeakable evils and survive hordes of monstrous Orcs in visceral combat, while uncovering the secret of the Shadow that looms within the mountain."

Eight-player co-op is on the table, which is likely one of the bigger selling points of Return to Moria for the studio. A spring 2023 window for the Epic Games Store is teased. The copyright is with Middle-earth Enterprises (not the Tolkien Estate), so like other similar projects, they'll be limited in what they can cover from The Legendarium (as is customary for the vast majority of Tolkien-related media). But given that the core book series pretty much gives them free rein on Moria, they should be good there.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=75nbOL7GOPE
The post Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria is a…Tolkien survival simulator? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria is a…Tolkien survival simulator?

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The Dragon Age is coming to Netflix
Today, Netflix and BioWare announced a new collaboration to bring Dragon Age to the streaming platform. Dragon Age: Absolution is a new series set in the world of Thedas, arriving this December on Netflix.
Shown off during today's Netflix Geeked stream, Dragon Age: Absolution is a six-episode series. It'll follow a set of new characters from the world of Dragon Age. That includes elves, Qunari, mages, knights, and some other surprises.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2A1PSiPSs_k
Dragon Age: Absolution is set in Tevinter, which has some interesting implications. Plus, with the next Dragon Age game also heading Tevinter, the Netflix series could potentially set up storylines. Or it might just be a good entry point for newcomers. Either way, Tevinter is definitely an interesting place to go; it's a region full of magic, mystery, and intrigue.
The Dread Wolf nears
As for the Dragon Age series in the gaming realm, BioWare recently announced the title for its next entry. Dragon Age: Dreadwolf will be the next mainline game, with the player heading to Tevinter and dealing with a lingering threat in Solas.
The latest Dragon Age has been in development for a while, and BioWare has confirmed it won't launch in 2022. Basically, it's going to be a while before we get a new virtual adventure in Thedas. In the meantime, this streaming series will be something for fans to dig into and pick apart, at the least.
Dragon Age: Absolution is another step of Netflix diving deeper into the world of video game adaptations, too. A new Cyberpunk anime was already announced, and its live-action Resident Evil adaptation arrives soon. Today's stream also had news about Netflix's Tekken series, The Cuphead Show, and the next book of Dota: Dragon's Blood. And now, the streaming service will break into the fantasy world of Thedas.
The post Netflix reveals Dragon Age: Absolution, arriving this December appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Netflix reveals Dragon Age: Absolution, arriving this December

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
"We still like to think of it as it works perfectly as a DLC piece"
Studio MDHR has been busy. Like, busy for the last five years or so, busy. Cuphead came out in September of 2017! From the original PC and Xbox One platforms it expanded to Switch in 2019, and PS4 in 2020. But it definitely feels like it came out recently, namely due to the airtight gameplay and evergreen aesthetic. If what we've seen of the Delicious Last Course DLC is representative of what's to come, odds are it'll be relevant for even longer. Here's our Cuphead DLC preview.
We had the chance to sit down and watch a hands-off presentation of the Cuphead DLC, hosted by Chad, Jared, and Maja Moldenhauer; as well as Studio MDHR producer Eli Cymet. Kicking things off Cymet framed the presentation by noting that this was a "…
articles.title: Cuphead DLC preview: “We wanted to make a really cool sendoff…it kind of blew up”

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Part 2 is live
The Fallout 76 Dread Island storyline has been extended, as part 2 of the new radio play drama is out: you can listen to it now!
The meta narrative follows the brother and sister team of Anna and Emilio, alongside of their very Lost in Space-esque robot companion H-4RT, as they explore and survive Dread Island.  Bethesda is saying that the "final two chapters" will arrive next week. In a really cool turn, you can listen to these radio plays in-game via your Pip-Boy (on the Pirate Radio station).
In other Fallout 76 news, Season 9 and the Test Your Metal update is set to arrive on June 14, which will inject a ton of new content into the game beyond the typical season pass refresh. The team reminds folks that extra public events will be available (Ruse Eagle Arena, Moonshine Jamboree, and Eviction notice), as well as quality of life upgrades like spotting downed enemies with a more obvious yellow highlight.
This weekend is also hosting a "Gold Rush" event: "Throughout this weekend, you can visit the Gold Press Machines at The Crater and Foundation to exchange your Treasury Notes for up to double the usual daily amount of Gold Bullion."
Fallout 76 Dread Island radio play part 2:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Az9QVCI2NDE
As a reminder, you can find part one here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b5YVUpnziW8&t
The post The Fallout 76 Dread Island story continues with a new radio play appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Fallout 76 Dread Island story continues with a new radio play

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Do Not Jump.
During yesterday's Summer Game Fest stream, Street Fighter fans received confirmation that America's Hero, Flaptop Fanatic, and all-round Family Man Col. Guile would be returning to the ring for the series' latest installment, Street Fighter 6. The trailer gave us one of our first real in-depth looks at the sequel's combat, while demonstrating the power of the RE engine in its ability to afford the military hero his first-ever set of eyebrows.
Indeed, for the first time in the mainline timeline since his franchise debut, Guile is rocking a sweet pair of eye caterpillars, proving that it was well worth me buying that PS5 console after all. In addition, he has also grown out a sweet goatee, which seems to be Capcom's go-to method of saying "This Character is Older". Much like hi…
articles.title: Street Fighter 6 utilizes the power of next-gen technology to give Guile eyebrows

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Super Star, Dream Land 3, and Dream Course
Nintendo just added three new Kirby SP games to the Switch Online service: building upon the existing original versions that already existed on Switch. As a reminder, "SP" versions are modified editions of Switch Online NES or SNES games that essentially have a "cheat/unlock" save out of the box. That's really it.
Breaking this down, here's what the Switch Online Kirby SP games do:
Kirby Super Star SP: You get Revenge of Meta Knight mode access immediately
Kirby's Dream Land 3 SP: An easier difficulty/extras are available
Kirby's Dream Course SP: Extras unlocked, including more multiplayer stages (this is probably the most useful of the three)
SP versions started off as a cute little flight of fancy bonus, but at this point people are asking for an option to hide them entirely from the interface: which has become more unwieldy and bloated as more games have been added. Initially "SP" seemed like something special, like maybe an official ROM hack or a different edition of a classic game: but they turned out to just be, by and large, save-doctored retreads.
Another issue is that Nintendo potentially sees these as "updates," which slows down future games from becoming part of the service sooner. It's tough to tell what the actual cadence of games is for the Switch Online service by any metric, as "slow" generally sums it up: from the launch of the NES service all the way to the current era of Nintendo 64 and Genesis.
The post Nintendo just added three new Kirby SP SNES games to Switch Online appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Nintendo just added three new Kirby SP SNES games to Switch Online

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
A new report says Ragnarok will still arrive this year
One of Sony's heavy-hitters this year may still be on target. A new report indicates God of War Ragnarok is on track for a November launch, with a release date reveal expected later this month.
Bloomberg reports via three sources familiar with the project that God of War Ragnarok is planned for November. This comes after an earlier report that the new God of War had slipped to 2023.
Jason Schreier of Bloomberg cast doubt on the 2023 news yesterday. His new report seems to affirm that Ragnarok will arrive this year. No dates are set in stone with development, but the report indicates that as of this week, it's still on track for November. Bloomberg's report does note that Ragnarok has slipped internally. Earlier this year, it was reportedly set to arrive in September, but was recently bumped to November.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EE-4GvjKcfs
This is some reassuring news for fans who might have been concerned after God of War Ragnarok was absent from both the Sony State of Play and yesterday's Summer Game Fest. The follow-up to 2018's God of War has been a hotly anticipated game since it was first teased.
Fimbulwinter in November
While some ratings board movement indicated Ragnarok may still be set for this year, today's report adds some more certainty. As of this writing, Sony has not officially announced a date for God of War Ragnarok, outside a 2022 window.
It's been a leaky couple of days for Sony, as The Last of Us Remake news slipped out ahead of schedule yesterday. The rekindling of the original Last of Us was set to be the closer for Summer Game Fest.
The June State of Play held last week focused mainly on third-party titles, so it's no surprise people are curious about what Sony's first-party lineup looks like right now. Hopefully as the summer of games news rolls on, we'll get a firmer idea of what's in store for PlayStation.
The post God of War Ragnarok is reportedly planned to launch in November appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: God of War Ragnarok is reportedly planned to launch in November

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
It's 600 platinum
Typically, Nintendo has been updating the My Nintendo physical reward storefront (paid for by way of platinum points currency) with every first-party release. Switch Sports got a towel, and now Mario Strikers: Battle League has a drawstring bag.
The bag is 600 platinum points, clocks in at 15"x18", and is double-sided (the front showcases the main logo, while the back has more roster members suited up in various poses). You can find the listing for it here.
Nintendo also has another little bonus: Mario Strikers party favors. By redeeming 30 platinum here, you can print seven pages of stuff yourself, including "eight invitations, four cupcake holders, six pennant flags, and six party toppers."
As a reminder, if you want physical rewards, you can find our full Platinum Point guide here, which has been updated with details on weekly missions: bookmark it for when you need quick points for a reward. A handful of points is incredibly easy to get, as that’s basically just 15 minutes with Super Mario Run, or a quick sign-on to the 3DS or Wii U 3Shop. Also remember that any shipments are bundled together, so you can pay a flat rate for multiple items instead of paying it each time. Just know that items go out of stock on My Nintendo frequently, and some are never restocked.
The post The newest My Nintendo reward is a Mario Strikers drawstring bag appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The newest My Nintendo reward is a Mario Strikers drawstring bag

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
June 16 at 6PM ET
So remember when Geoff Keighly said that he thinks publishers have learned that they should probably have "30 minutes plus" conferences, or less micro-conferences in general? Well Square Enix has a 10 minute Final Fantasy VII stream planned for June 16 at 6PM ET.
For reference, here's the quote:
“There were a lot of shows last year where everyone was disappointed when they weren’t really press conferences, right? Like Take-Two, Capcom, Square Enix and things like that…I think [they] have learned that if you’re going to do a press conference, you kind of need to have 30 minutes-plus of stuff, and sometimes they only have one or two great games to show, which may not be enough to do a full event around. So I think that’s going to be a bit of a shift. I have a pretty good sense of what’s coming in the next month, and I think people will be hyped about games in general.”

Welp!
The stream kicks off below at 6PM ET on June 16, with the following caveat from Tetsuya Nomura: "At only around 10 minutes long, it will be short and sweet, but we have packed in lots of information, so I hope everyone can look forward to the unveiling." Add it to the pile! Less obvious candidates include a tease for Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 2 or some new media project; more obvious candidates are mobile developments for VII-related projects.
If Square Enix doesn't show anything related to Part 2  in this Final Fantasy VII stream, they're just setting themselves up for disappointment. Can you imagine the reaction if it was just a stream for First Soldier and Ever Crisis?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wohQiEysqIA
The post Square Enix is hosting a “short and sweet” Final Fantasy VII stream soon appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Square Enix is hosting a “short and sweet” Final Fantasy VII stream soon

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Who's Bad?
The mysterious legacy of the Sonic 3 soundtrack has reared its head once again, as Sega has revealed that upcoming retro compilation Sonic Origins will not feature the original score from the 1994 release. Instead, Sonic 3 & Knuckles will feature an "adapted" soundtrack, faithfully recreated by composer Jun Senoue.
Sonic fans had been awaiting news on the Sonic Origins soundtrack situation, well aware that Sonic 3 score is mired in misty red tape due to the alleged input of one Michael Jackson, who supposedly composed some of the game's tracks despite not actually being credited in-game. Since its release, both members of Michael Jackson's team and Sega executives have delivered mixed messages as to whether "The King of Pop" did indeed work on the best-selling Sega Mega Drive title, with no real confirmation either way.
https://twitter.com/TailsChannel/status/1535011473218494487?s=20&t=PZcbCmTmIdkgAhJn58Zwnw
In a special Sonic Origins live stream held yesterday, social media manager Katie Chrzanowski clarified that the Sonic Origins edition of Sonic 3 & Knuckles will feature a recomposed version of the original score, with Senoue even utilizing original Sega Mega Drive technology and his original collection of Digital Audio Tape (DAT) to truly capture that classic 16-bit feel.
While the fact that Sonic 3 is not being 100% replicated in its entirety will be a disappointment to the fanbase, Senoue is one of the best in the biz, with no doubt that the tweaked score will be equally as compelling as the one that Jackson did... I mean did not... write.
Sonic Origins launches June 23 on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch platforms.
The post Sonic Origins to feature an ‘adapted’ soundtrack for Sonic 3 & Knuckles appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sonic Origins to feature an ‘adapted’ soundtrack for Sonic 3 & Knuckles

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Welcome to Shit City (literally that's the name of the city)
After a busy day of Summer Game Festing, I'm pretty much spent, but leave it to Devolver Digital (and Suda) to supercharge my brain for a bit with another chaotic showcase. On one extreme, we saw the adorable 2D-meets-3D storybook adventure The Plucky Squire — and on the other, there was Anger Foot, a face-kicking action game for sickos.
The first gameplay glimpse from developer Free Lives (Broforce, GORN, Terra Nil) looks unhinged. I'm talking "Academy Award winner Russell Crowe in Unhinged" unhinged.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7R1XJv-pylk
It's one of the most no-bullshit, take-it-or-leave-it showings I've seen in a while, and I also appreciate the synopsis, which reinforces this game's unrelenting mood.
"Unleash the world's deadliest feet on a colorful cast of anthropomorphic enemies," as Devolver Digital and Free Lives put it. "Clearing out slums, sewers, and skyscrapers as you grab new weapons, unlock new sneakers, and upgrade your powers in absurd and wonderful ways. Kick and shoot your way to the exit as you leave behind a smoldering trail of shattered doors, broken bones, and crumpled energy drinks."
I can already tell Anger Foot will be the kind of game where there's an ideal "wow, that went smooth!" way to play, and getting the flow down just right will surely take practice. In the meantime, I'm sure it'll be funny to fumble your way through these setups, too. If you've ever wondered how Hotline Miami would (or could) translate its frantic room-clearing carnage to 3D, well, this is probably the closest we're getting for now.
General mood aside, you don't need to take the reveal trailer's word for it — there's a demo right now on Steam. Anger Foot is planning a 2023 release.
The post Anger Foot might be Devolver Digital’s most unhinged game yet appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Anger Foot might be Devolver Digital’s most unhinged game yet

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
This is a whole vibe
Sometimes, you just have to skate. And sometimes, you make a deal with the devil and you really, really do just have to skate. Skate Story is a game about the latter, coming sometime in 2023.
Shown off during today's Devolver Digital summer showcase, Skate Story is about a deal with the devil. You, as a demon made of glass and pain, have to skate to the moon and swallow it to earn your freedom. Simple enough, right?
Seeing it in motion, though, is something else. It's reminding me of Thumper, but with chiller music and sick kickflips. I've probably watched the trailer below at least a half-dozen times already.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x6j0zKSXAFE
The camera angle is absolutely wonderful too. Its shown in a way that reminds me of old skate videos. As you course through the underworld, you'll also get new decks, wheels, and trucks, as well as a host of tricks to really add some style to your cruising.
Skating through it all
Skateboarding games are always interesting to me, but even over the last couple years, skating has been reimagined in some fascinating ways. The Ramp put a minimalist spin on just the raw action. And OlliOlli World takes a level-based approach with a story and goals that really added a lot to the experience.
That's what excites me about Skate Story in this trailer. It's a whole different vibe, and one I'm really gelling with the more I see it. Developer Sam Eng has posted some great technical looks at the tricks in play, and they are just a joy to watch.
https://twitter.com/skatestorygame/status/1486147388255395840
Suffice to say, I'm looking forward to nailing some sick tricks in the surreal dream world of Skate Story when it arrives in 2023. It's up on Steam now, if you'd like to add it to your wishlist.
The post Skate Story is a dreamlike skateboarding game coming next year appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Skate Story is a dreamlike skateboarding game coming next year

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
A cult in lamb's clothing
This summer, it's finally time to start the cutest lil' cult you ever did see. Cult of the Lamb will launch on August 11 for PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Switch.
The news was part of today's Devolver Digital summer showcase. In between skits about Mecha-Suda51 and the convergence of all video games, Massive Monster's adorable roguelike-meets-management game finally locked in a release date. We also got a new animated trailer here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CI6D2iYCTcU
A demo for Cult of the Lamb is live on Steam today too, ahead of its August launch date. That way you can try out taking over the woods before you buy all the way in.
Building up a new following
Cult of the Lamb follows a little lamb, who narrowly avoids being destroyed only to become beholden to a dark spirit. Paying back your debt means assisting this spirit in taking over the woodlands and destroying the other prophets.
Along the way, you can recruit a following of other happy creatures to do your bidding. That means harvesting crops, building new structures, and gradually constructing a quaint home base you can visit between escapades.

It's a cool town-building twist on the usual action-roguelike formula. I got to demo a build at PAX East earlier this year, and was really own over both by its style and its compelling management.
As the summer showcases start to ramp up, it's nice to see a cool project get locked in for a release date, and so soon at that. Looks like I'll be building up my own following in just a few months.
Cult of the Lamb arrives on August 11 for PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo Switch.
The post Adorable cult builder Cult of the Lamb launches on August 11 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Adorable cult builder Cult of the Lamb launches on August 11

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Endless color and creativity
I'm always on the lookout for creative new titles that are doing things in games that we haven't seen quite yet, and The Plucky Squire looks to be exactly that. We got a glimpse at the game during today's Devolver Digital Showcase, and the trailer showcased adorable 2D gameplay that took place in a storybook, before shifting to 3D gameplay, and back to 2D again. The gameplay itself looks like a combination of side-scrolling and hack-and-slash gameplay, with some puzzles and fighting game sections?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bGwAtbQIC_8
I honestly love the fact that I can't pin down exactly what this experience will be like, because that likely means it will keep us on our toes the whole way through. It's colorful, it's playful, and looks like a breath of fresh air in this year's sea of dark, violent sci-fi shooters. The Plucky Squire is in development by All Possible Futures, and of course will be published by Devolver Digital. No release date yet, but the game is available to wishlist on Steam right now, and it will be coming out on PC, Xbox Series X/S, PS5, and Nintendo Switch sometime in 2023.
The post The Plucky Squire is an imaginative new 2D and 3D combo adventure game appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Plucky Squire is an imaginative new 2D and 3D combo adventure game

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
See more of what the publisher has in store for the future
Another showcase is arriving this summer, though this one won't be until next month. Annapurna Interactive announced today that it's hosting a publisher showcase on July 28, 2022.
The news came at the end of the Day of the Devs showcase, following the Summer Game Fest Live stream. Annapurna Interactive says it will be bringing reveals, announcements, and more to its showcase.
Its stream will go live on July 28 at 12 p.m. PT / 3 p.m. ET on Annapurna's Twitch and YouTube channels.
https://twitter.com/A_i/status/1535003761550102528
The streams of summer
A few of Annapurna Interactive's published titles have already been spotlighted in other showcases. The crazy cat adventure Stray got a release date of July 12 during the recent Sony S…
articles.title: The 2022 Annapurna Interactive showcase airs July 28

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Tons of indies with some killer vibes
Today marks the Summer Game Fest kick-off, and both the Live showcase and ensuing Day of the Devs have come to a close. In the latter, there were a bunch of really rad games, from both well-known developers and exciting newcomers.
While the Summer Game Fest Live showcase tends to focus on bigger games, the Day of the Devs: Summer Game Fest Edition showcase centered on smaller projects and teams. It's a tradition that Double Fine has organized for a decade at this point, and it's always nice to see what neat projects make their way into the showcase.
This year had some absolute winners, too. Bear and Breakfast continues to look like a chill, fun management sim and it's arriving very soon. So is Escape Academy, a school life-meets-puzzle room adventure. …
articles.title: Everything shown at today’s Day of the Devs: Summer Game Fest Edition showcase

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I think we need E3
Well, it's here! The initial "big push" Summer Game Fest stream just ended. Here's a big old Summer Game Fest 2022 recap: emphasis on old.
Vibe check? I was heavily reminded of the low-key artifice of the PC Gaming Show throughout, where it was hard to tell what was actually a reveal and what had been shown weeks or months ago. There were lots of ads and a few "exclusives/world firsts" that were basically modified existing trailers. The Rock stopped by through a Zoom call to plug his energy drink (twice) and showed off a trailer for his new movie, Black Adam. The "one more thing" final announcement was a The Last of Us remake, which wouldn't have hit that hard for a lot of people (myself included) even if it wasn't leaked.
The lower energy aura has been the prevailing wi…
articles.title: Recap: Everything that happened at Summer Game Fest 2022

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
"Insanity runs in our family"
After Blair Witch and The Medium, Bloober Team is returning to the world of Layers of Fear with a "psychedelic" horror game, Layers of Fears, that's being developed in Unreal Engine 5 alongside Anshar Studios. A trailer debuted at Summer Game Fest 2022 with familiar characters and scenes from the wider series, albeit looking better than ever.
https://youtu.be/AwEXJ3T1EJM
It really feels like history is repeating itself, both in terms of the tortured artist storyline and the gameplay of Layers of Fear 1 and 2 (and Inheritance, the game with the painter's daughter, which is easily forgotten about and will likely end up feeling the freshest here). We've seen tons of remasters and even full-on remakes in recent years, but this is blurring the lines in a way that I wasn't expecting after Bloober Team's recent teases.
"Layers of Fears will be the complete, definitive, and at the same time unpredictable way to discover the stories of artists enslaved by their obsessions," according to Bloober Team. "Prepare for an exquisite horror experience thanks to the expanded plot lines that will cast a new light on the overarching narrative." You can see some screenshots on Steam.

The developers say they're "focused on tense exploration and immersive storytelling," though that's going to be a hard sell for some people based on the series so far.
I personally have had my fun with Layers of Fear (and to a lesser extent its direct sequel), so I'm curious if Layers of Fears will end up feeling fresh enough, conceptually, to justify itself. The visual fidelity is clearly a step up from the original games, but that can only take me so far. In general, this spooky (?) series has a lot of fans — and a lot of haters.
Layers of Fears is heading to PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC through Steam and the Epic Games Store.
The post Layers of Fears captures the whole series in one new horror trip appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Layers of Fears captures the whole series in one new horror trip

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
'I got this, Bruce...'
Warner Bros. Games has released a new trailer for its upcoming DC Comics title Gotham Knights. Currently in development for PC and new-gen consoles, the hard-hitting vigilante adventure will launch this fall, following a recent delay.
During Summer Game Fest, we go to see a new trailer focusing entirely on the acrobatic, highly-skilled martial artist, Nightwing. A former protege of The Batman himself, Dick Grayson would eventually break off from his role in The Dynamic Duo, striking out for himself as a peacekeeper in the mean streets of Gotham City. His incredible ninjitsu abilities and baton-based hand-to-hand skills fast-flatten any perp foolhardy enough to stand in his way.
Nightwing will be joined by Batgirl, Red Hood, and Robin in the new multiplayer title.
Gotham Knights launches October 25 on PS5, PC, and Xbox Series X.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nsl7-wkkdUs
The post Gotham Knights looks to the shadows for the aerial avenger, Nightwing appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Gotham Knights looks to the shadows for the aerial avenger, Nightwing

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
With six extra cultures
Humankind kind of came and went for me, but today, we're reminded that stuff is still actively coming out for it: like the Humankind Cultures of Latin America Pack that came out today.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mDo_wyO1MBk
Here's a full rundown of the Humankind Cultures of Latin America DLC content:
6 New Cultures
6 New Wonders
9 Independent Peoples
15 Narrative Events
30+ New in-game themed music tracks composed by Arnaud Roy
I have to admit, the idea of more civilizations and things to do, along with quality of life features, has me interested in potentially jumping back in. Also, the Summer Game Fest trailer reveal had another tidbit of info: the game is coming to consoles (PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X) and "will be playable from day one on Xbox Game Pass."
The Humankind - Heritage Edition on Console will include:
Digital Game
Cultures of Latin America Pack
Cultures of Africa Pack
Notre-Dame Pack
As long as it turns out OK, that's probably where I'll jump back in. On Game Pass, no less! With some DLC to boot! Sounds like how a lot of people are experiencing games in 2022, given how overwhelming any given moment can be when something is actually released.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UNE6JOrN0nw
The post Humankind is coming to consoles/Game Pass, new DLC out today appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Humankind is coming to consoles/Game Pass, new DLC out today

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Be the boss of your dreams, or nightmares
The new Saints Row isn't out until August, but you can perfect your look a little early. Deep Silver and Volition have launched a Saints Row character creator dubbed the "Boss Factory," and it's out now for free on PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X.
The Boss Factory will let you craft all kinds of looks for your avatar, the Boss, and I really mean all kinds. Today's trailer showed everything from giant body-builder types to wild costumes, and even a Nosferatu-looking Boss. Finally, I can live out my crime-vampire dreams.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHHgTmdjyl0
Big Boss energy
Saints Row has always been known for its more out-there vibes. But it's also nice to see some options that really open up character creation, whether that's making someone that feels more representative of you in the world, or just becoming the nocturnal ghoul you've always hoped to be. The creator advertises thousands of options, from teeth and make-up to muscles, tattoos, and skin tints. Heck, even the veins are customizable in the Saints Row Boss Factory. It's a slider I never even thought to consider.
This character creator will let you get everything set, so your perfect Boss is ready by Aug. 23 when Saints Row launches on PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. And in the meantime, you can live out your wildest Nightmare Factory dreams. Find the Saints Row Boss Factory at Epic here, the PlayStation Store here, and the Xbox store here.
The post Saints Row Boss Factory lets you craft your own Boss starting today appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Saints Row Boss Factory lets you craft your own Boss starting today

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Get ready for some punchy FPS goodness
Today we got a new look at gameplay for the upcoming Warhammer 40,000: Darktide via a two-minute trailer which gave us a look at one of the missions we'll get to experience in the game. Pre-orders for this bombastic FPS adventure are available now for PC and Xbox Series X/S, and players can get pre-order bonuses like weapon trinkets, outfits, and more. Warhammer 40,000: Darktide will be releasing on September 13, 2022.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GR7I2D6ENrA&feature=youtu.be
Developer Fatshark's CEO Martin Wahlund has this to share: “It’s been an exciting, and maybe a little crazy week for Fatshark, with two brand new Warhammer 40,000: Darktide trailers released. While last week’s amazing Warhammer Skulls trailer focused more on story, gameplay is what it all comes down to, and today we gave you almost 120 seconds of Darktide.”
The post Warhammer 40,000: Darktide gets a new gameplay trailer appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide gets a new gameplay trailer

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
You gotta know when to hold 'em...
Inflexion Games has released a brand new trailer for its atmospheric fantasy crafting adventure Nightingale to the Summer Game Fest showcase.
As an intrepid explorer, or "Realmwalker", players will be tasked with scavenging the land, fending off wildlife and predators while gathering the ingredients necessary to craft magical decks of cards. These cards offer the power to create mysterious, dimension-crossing portals. If you thought this world and its denizens were dangerous enough, just wait until you see what's waiting for you on the other side...
Nightingale will launch later in 2022 on PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jno59gI3Wv4
The post Nightingale blends survival and card-crafting in a fantasy gaslit world appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Nightingale blends survival and card-crafting in a fantasy gaslit world

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
All aboard the Astral Express
HoYoverse showed up at Summer Game Fest 2022 with a fresh look at Honkai: Star Rail, an upcoming turn-based space RPG that's coming for our free time and wallets.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XJGG1PCVk0Y
Today's trailer focuses on some of the (many) companions you'll meet and the "exotic" Xianzhou Luofu location. Even without context, I kind of enjoyed the sights and sounds.
As the next step in the Honkai series, Honkai: Star Rail is looking to rope in a fresh audience with its "newcomer-friendly strategic turn-based combat system" as well as "maze exploration, puzzle-solving, and instant action elements," according to the developers.
This is my first real introduction to the game, and I am all about sipping tea while explosive space battles unfold in the background. Is this more your vibe than the usual Genshin Impact flair, or are you fully invested in Teyvat already (thanks but no thanks)? There are only so many hours in the day to make new friends, you know? Maybe a turn-based approach is more your speed, or maybe you're just more into the interstellar vibe.
Honkai: Star Rail is coming to PC and mobile platforms, and while we don't have a release date, the game has been getting in front of players with playtests.
The post HoYoverse RPG Honkai: Star Rail got a flashy Summer Game Fest trailer appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: HoYoverse RPG Honkai: Star Rail got a flashy Summer Game Fest trailer

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Even more turtle power
The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are getting even more back-up for their next outing. Today, DotEmu locked in a launch date of June 16 for TMNT: Shredder's Revenge, and Casey Jones is joining the fray.
Today's trailer at the Summer Game Fest showcase debuted Casey in all his hockey-masked glory. Casey will fight alongside the turtles, their master Splinter, and beat-em-up reporter April O'Neil.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qyfKYsSDDb4
Also confirmed is local and online co-op for up to six players. Yes, that means a lot of chaos on the screen all at once. But isn't that a plus?
Six-player mayhem
TMNT: Shredder's Revenge impressed me a lot when I played it at PAX East earlier this year, and adding both more players and Casey Jones is just icing on top. Dotemu's garnered a good reputation for brawlers at this point, with its previous work on projects like Streets of Rage 4.
With TMNT: Shredder's Revenge though, it really feels like they're honing in on that Saturday morning brawler feeling. In my demo, it felt fairly easy to pick up and play as anyone, and the fighters all felt very individual. After seeing April bash someone with a boom mic, I'm pretty thrilled to see what the team has concocted for Casey Jones. Add in a ton of multiplayer mayhem, and June's looking like a good time for a couch co-op party.
The brawling gets underway next week when TMNT: Shredder's Revenge hits PS4, Xbox One, PC, and Nintendo Switch on June 16.
The post TMNT: Shredder’s Revenge hits June 16, with Casey Jones in the lineup appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: TMNT: Shredder’s Revenge hits June 16, with Casey Jones in the lineup

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Battle it out with your favorite hero
Super People aims to put a new spin on the battle royale genre with super powered characters.
